title: Sri Lanka President talks with 41 group inconclusive: legislator
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Talks between President Gotabaya Rajapksa and a group of 41 ‘independent’ legislators who have distanced themselves from his administration has ended inconclusively, one member of the faction said.
Earlier a group of 11 parties had suggested an interim administration under a different Prime Minister.
“We could not go as far as that (the interim government proposal),” breakaway legislator Vasudeva Nanayakkara told reporters said following the evening meeting.
He said the meeting was ‘to maintain links’ and nothing conclusive had come out of it.
Political sources had said earlier in the week that Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa had indicated some willingness to step down and there was a possibility of him being replaced.

There are daily protests in the country asking President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to step down. On Sunday Sri Lanka Podujana Party activists stages protests in Kandy and Tangalle, Mahinda Rajapaksa’s home district, in the support of the family. (Colombo/Apr09/2022)
